axs15231.docs:
The `axs15231` touchscreen platform allows using the touch screen controllers based on the AXS15231 chip with ESPHome. An [I²C](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c) bus is required to be set up in your configuration for this touchscreen to work.

*See also: [AXS15231 Touch Screen Controller](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/axs15231.html#axs15231-touch-screen-controller)*

sdl.docs:
The `sdl` touchscreen platform allows emulating a touch screen by using the mouse with the `sdl` display driver. The `sdl` display component must be configured to use this.

*See also: [SDL2 Touch Screen Emulator](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/sdl.html#sdl2-touch-screen-emulator)*

xpt2046.docs:
The `xpt2046` touchscreen platform allows using the resistive touch screen controllers based on the XPT2046 chip ([datasheet](https://datasheetspdf.com/pdf-file/746665/XPTEK/XPT2046/1), [AZ-Delivery](https://www.az-delivery.de/en/products/2-4-tft-lcd-touch-display)) with ESPHome. Many cheap LCD displays contain this controller. The [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#spi) is required to be set up in your configuration for this sensor to work.

*See also: [XPT2046 Touch Screen Controller (Updated version)](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/xpt2046.html#xpt2046-touch-screen-controller-updated-version)*

x_min.docs:
**int**: The raw value corresponding to the left (or top if `swap_xy` is specified) edge of the touchscreen. See [Calibration](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#touchscreen-calibration) for the process to calibrate the touchscreen.

*See also: [XPT2046 Touch Screen Controller (Updated version)](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

x_max.docs:
**int**: The raw value corresponding to the right (or bottom if `swap_xy` is specified) edge of the touchscreen.

*See also: [XPT2046 Touch Screen Controller (Updated version)](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

y_min.docs:
**int**: The raw value corresponding to the top (or left if `swap_xy` is specified) edge of the touchscreen.

*See also: [XPT2046 Touch Screen Controller (Updated version)](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

y_max.docs:
**int**: The raw value corresponding to the bottom (or right if `swap_xy` is specified) edge of the touchscreen.

*See also: [XPT2046 Touch Screen Controller (Updated version)](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

display.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The display to use this touchscreen with.

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

swap_xy.docs:
**boolean**: If true, exchange the x and y axes.

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

mirror_x.docs:
**boolean**: If true, mirror the x axis.

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

mirror_y.docs:
**boolean**: If true, mirror the y axis.

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

transform.docs:
Transform the touchscreen presentation using hardware. All defaults are `false`.
  * **swap_xy** (*Optional*, boolean): If true, exchange the x and y axes.
  
  * **mirror_x** (*Optional*, boolean): If true, mirror the x axis.
  
  * **mirror_y** (*Optional*, boolean): If true, mirror the y axis.
  
  

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

touch_timeout.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: A timeout for touchscreens that do not report the end of touch. The default varies depending on the touchscreen.

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

calibration.docs:
Some touchscreens require calibration on a per-device basis.
  * **x_min** (**Required**, int): The raw value corresponding to the left (or top if `swap_xy` is specified) edge of the touchscreen. See [Calibration](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#touchscreen-calibration) for the process to calibrate the touchscreen.
  
  * **x_max** (**Required**, int): The raw value corresponding to the right (or bottom if `swap_xy` is specified) edge of the touchscreen.
  
  * **y_min** (**Required**, int): The raw value corresponding to the top (or left if `swap_xy` is specified) edge of the touchscreen.
  
  * **y_max** (**Required**, int): The raw value corresponding to the bottom (or right if `swap_xy` is specified) edge of the touchscreen.
  
  

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

on_touch.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the touchscreen is touched. See [on_touch Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#touchscreen-on-touch).

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

on_update.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the touchscreen is touched. See [on_update Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#touchscreen-on-update).

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

on_release.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the touchscreen is no longer touched. See [on_release Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#touchscreen-on-release).

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The touchscreen polling interval - used only if an interrupt pin is not in use. Defaults to `50ms`.

*See also: [Touchscreen Components](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#configuration-variables)*

touchscreen_id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the touchscreen.

*See also: [touchscreen Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#id5)*

x_min.docs:
**int**: Left coordinate of the screen area to be detected as the virtual button.

*See also: [touchscreen Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#id5)*

x_max.docs:
**int**: Right coordinate of the screen area to be detected as the virtual button.

*See also: [touchscreen Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#id5)*

y_min.docs:
**int**: Top coordinate of the screen area to be detected as the virtual button.

*See also: [touchscreen Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#id5)*

y_max.docs:
**int**: Bottom coordinate of the screen area to be detected as the virtual button.

*See also: [touchscreen Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#id5)*

page_id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Only trigger this binary sensor if the display is showing this page. Cannot be used with `pages`.

*See also: [touchscreen Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#id5)*

pages.docs:
**list of [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Only trigger this binary sensor if the display is showing one of these pages. Cannot be used with `page_id`.

*See also: [touchscreen Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/touchscreen/index.html#id5)*
